New Records: The White Sox snapped a historic streak for the White Sox, dropping 20 consecutive games started by Chris Flexen, an MLB record.
Key Match Events: The White Sox rallied for five hits off Red Sox reliever Zack Kelly in a five-run inning that quieted the home crowd and sent many a Fenway Faithful packing.
Dominic Fletcher fired a 2-2 cutter up the left-field line, past a light-tower shadow and into the corner in deep left to drive in Bryan Ramos and snap the tie.
Korey Lee threw out Trevor Story as the Red Sox shortstop tried to steal second in the third inning.
Luis Robert Jr. capped the scoring with a sac fly to score Jacob Amaya.
Pre-Game Insights: Interim manager Grady Sizemore put it plainly: the White Sox just want to play clean, competitive baseball.
Post-Match Reflections: Sizemore said, 'I think when you look at today's game, we played very clean. Took care of the ball, made some great plays, good throws. And then we had some clutch at-bats. I mean that's what we want.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Korey Lee entered the finale with an average pop time of 1.85 seconds (97th percentile), tied with the Phillies’ J.T. Realmuto and the Giants’ Patrick Bailey for the best in MLB.
Others: Chris Flexen recorded his 10th quality start of the season and his third in his past four starts.
The White Sox ensured a happy flight home with Sunday's win.
